sen.j: 安日彦（あびひこ）は中世日本紀に伝わる伝説の人物の一人。
sen.e: Abihiko is a legendary person in Chusei Nihongi (A set of medieval Japanese mythologies).

sen.j: 鎌倉時代～室町時代成立の『曽我物語』に蝦夷の祖を流罪にされた鬼王安日とする伝承が記載されている。
sen.e: In "Sogamonogatari" (the tale of Soga), which was established during the Kamakura through Muromachi periods, Abihiko is described as Demon King Abi who was exiled from the ancestral Ezo (northerners).

sen.j: 長髄彦の兄とされ、彼と共に青森県の弘前に逃れたとも、単独で津軽地方に流されたとも伝わる。
sen.e: Abihiko is supposed to be the older brother of Nagasunehiko, and some say that Abihiko and Nagasunehiko made an escape to Hirosaki in Aomori Prefecture, and others say that Abihiko was singly exiled to the Tsugaru region.

sen.e: However, neither "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) nor "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) does not mention about Abihiko.

sen.e: Abihiko is generally regarded as a fictious person, but a theory says that Abihiko is actually the same person as Nagasunehiko.
